dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Conversational and analytical, breaking down a news story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, you might have seen some headlines floating around recently about, like, a mansion in Beverly Hills. Donald Trump’s old place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, you might have seen some headlines floating around recently about, like, a mansion in Beverly Hills. Donald Trump's old place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the one everyone was saying he, uh, radically overpaid for? Rachel Maddow even did a whole segment on it, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the one everyone was saying he, uh, radically overpaid for? Rachel Maddow even did a whole segment on it, I think.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And Thursday night, MSNBC host Rachel Maddow ran a lengthy segment on the deal, asking: Why did someone just radically overpay the president for a property in Los Angeles?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! There was this huge buzz, you know, suggesting someone just shelled out way too much cash to the president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! There was this huge buzz, you know, suggesting someone just shelled out way too much cash to the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it was tied to, like, an Indonesian billionaire, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, right? So it just felt… fishy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it was tied to, like, an Indonesian billionaire, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, right? So it just felt... fishy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The next day, the Washington Post reported that Hillcrest has ties to Indonesian billionaire Hary Tanoesoedibjo and suggested that the house may have gone for an inflated price.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. But here’s the thing, uh, when you dig into it a bit, the "overpaid" part? That might not actually be true.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. But here's the thing, uh, when you dig into it a bit, the overpaid part? That might not actually be true.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? I thought the whole point was, like, it went for way more than it was worth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? I thought the whole point was, like, it went for way more than it was worth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Forbes had actually valued it at around $13 million just a few months prior. And local real estate brokers, they were saying it could go anywhere from $11 to $15 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Forbes had actually valued it at around thirteen million dollars just a few months prior. And local real estate brokers, they were saying it could go anywhere from eleven to fifteen million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February, Forbes valued the property at $13 million as part of its twice-annual look at the size of Donald Trumps fortune. That estimate, just 4% off the reported sales price, was based on conversations with five local real estate brokers, who suggested the property could be worth anywhere from $11 million to $15 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So the $13.5 million sale price was, uh, squarely in that range?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the thirteen point five million dollar sale price was, uh, squarely in that range?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reported $13.5 million price was squarely within the range of what could be expected for the house.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! Even the broker who gave the lowest estimate was like, "Nah, that’s, that’s not outrageous."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! Even the broker who gave the lowest estimate was like, Nah, that's, that's not outrageous.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even the broker who offered the lowest estimate, Joe Babajian of Rodeo Realty, said that $13.5 million was not an outrageous amount of money: Its definitely in the range.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. So all that hype about, uh, getting rich off the presidency, at least on the price, was maybe overblown?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So all that hype about, uh, getting rich off the presidency, at least on the price, was maybe overblown?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So despite all the hype, the recent sale is not necessarily an example of Trump getting richer off the presidency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It seems that way, yeah. The market in LA, it’s just completely different now than when he bought it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It seems that way, yeah. The market in L A, it's just completely different now than when he bought it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the market has changed over the last 12 years, and the true values of properties in Los Angeles County often diverge from their assessed values.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] But that doesn't mean it's, like, totally clean, right? There's still the buyer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that doesn't mean it's, like, totally clean, right? There's still the buyer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's where the *real* story is, honestly. Tanoesoedibjo, the Indonesian billionaire, he's a known business partner of Trump's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's where the real story is, honestly. Tanoesoedibjo, the Indonesian billionaire, he's a known business partner of Trump's.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tanoesoedibjo is an Indonesian business partner of Donald Trump, with his own ambitions for political office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, Trump's lawyer had, like, explicitly promised no new foreign deals during his presidency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, Trump's lawyer had, like, explicitly promised no new foreign deals during his presidency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly before Trumps inauguration, his lawyer promised no new foreign deals will be made whatsoever during the duration of President Trumps presidency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So if Tanoesoedibjo is indeed the buyer, which, uh, seems to be the case, this sale would directly violate that pledge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So if Tanoesoedibjo is indeed the buyer, which, uh, seems to be the case, this sale would directly violate that pledge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Tanoesoedibjo is in fact the buyer, the recent sale would seem to violate Trumps pledge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh. It just feels like, we've heard this before, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh. It just feels like, we've heard this before, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, he's had state-owned banks from China and India as tenants, and that Vegas condo sold to someone in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, he's had state-owned banks from China and India as tenants, and that Vegas condo sold to someone in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president has counted state-owned banks from China and India as tenants in two of his buildings. And last year, he even sold a Las Vegas condo to someone with a listed address in Taiyuan City, China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, less about the price, more about, uh, the repeated crossing of those ethical lines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, less about the price, more about, uh, the repeated crossing of those ethical lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's the pattern, not necessarily the, um, dollar amount that should really raise eyebrows here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's the pattern, not necessarily the, um, dollar amount that should really raise eyebrows here.
